TABLE OF CONTENTS

---PART ONE---
1 Six out of Eight Red Coins
2 80 Coin Stars
3 Skip Level Intro Messages
4 Increase Draw Distance on Coin Formations
5 Pole Fix
6 Star Road (Final Ver.) Mario Camera
7 Recover from Slidekicks with B
8 Pause Exit Acts as a Death Warp
9 RCVI Hack
10 Keep Camera Angle the Same While Paused

---PART TWO---
11 Blue Coin Switch Preview
12 Sunshine Silhouettes (without PPF/Rom Manager)
13 Individual Non-Stop Stars (No-ASM Alternative, + How to Use)
14 [ASM] Swimming Speed Modifier (+ Breakdown)

[11] BLUE COIN SWITCH PREVIEW
(credits to ZenonX)

*7D2B0:* 03 E0 00 08 00 00 00 00 27 BD FF E8 AF BF 00 14 AF B0 00 10 3C 01 80 36 8C 30 11 60 8E 02 01 4C 24 01 00 02 10 41 00 20 00 00 00 00 24 01 00 01 10 41 00 0F 00 00 00 00 14 40 00 42 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 7D 9B 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 81 6D 00 00 00 00 3C 01 13 00 0C 0A 7E 57 34 24 25 68 10 40 00 39 AE 02 00 F8 24 01 00 01 08 0B 08 FD AE 01 01 4C 8E 03 00 F8 8C 62 01 4C 24 04 00 02 14 44 00 03 00 00 00 00 AE 04 01 4C 8C 62 01 4C 24 01 00 03 14 41 00 21 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 7D 88 00 00 00 00 08 0B 08 FD 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 7D 88 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 81 75 00 00 00 00 92 01 01 36 30 21 00 80 10 20 00 08 00 00 00 00 3C 01 13 00 34 26 0A 14 02 00 20 25 0C 0A 7B 73 24 05 00 95 0C 0A 81 5A 02 00 20 25 3C 01 80 36 8C 22 11 60 8C 43 01 54 28 61 00 C8 14 20 00 13 00 00 00 00 94 44 00 02 30 61 00 01 14 20 00 08 00 00 00 00 30 81 FF EF 08 0B 08 FD A4 41 00 02 0C 0A 7D 9B 00 00 00 00 08 0B 08 FD 00 00 00 00 34 81 00 10 A4 41 00 02 28 61 00 F2 14 20 00 03 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 81 5A 02 00 20 25 8F B0 00 10 8F BF 00 14 03 E0 00 08 27 BD 00 18 27 BD FF E8 AF BF 00 14 AF B0 00 10 3C 01 80 36 8C 30 11 60 3C 01 80 2C C4 2C 25 B0 0C 0A 7D 0C 00 00 00 00 8E 02 01 4C 2C 41 00 04 10 20 00 57 00 00 00 00 00 02 08 80 3C 02 80 2C 00 22 08 21 8C 21 25 A0 00 20 00 08 00 00 00 00 3C 01 80 36 8C 21 11 58 8C 21 02 14 10 30 00 1F 00 00 00 00 08 0B 09 62 AE 00 01 4C 8E 01 01 54 28 21 00 05 14 20 00 2A 00 00 00 00 0C 0A 7D AF 00 00 21 00 C8 14 20 00 1B 00 00 00 00 3C 01 80 55 08 0B 09 50 34 24 F0 11 3C 01 00 80 34 21 02 3C 3C 02 80 34 24 42 B1 70 8C 42 00 0C 14 41 00 23 00 00 00 00 3C 01 C1 A0 AE 01 00 B0 24 01 00 01 AE 01 01 4C *21C383:* 04



[12] SUNSHINE SILHOUETTES (without PPF/Rom Manager):
(credits to FramePerfection, Kaze, scuttlebug_raiser and Blake)
(note: it could have been a bit shorter, but this ought to be most convenient)

*36A50:* 8F AC 00 1C 25 8D 00 01 29 A1 00 09 14 20 FF F7
*F8250:* 0C 09 E2 AE 24 05 00 5C AF A2 00 1C 8F AF 00 1C

*120F000:* 27 BD FF 98 84 8E 00 02 31 CF 00 08 00 0F C0 2B AF B8 00 5C 8F B9 00 5C 3C 09 80 33 25 29 DE 70 00 19 41 40 01 09 50 21 AF AA 00 58 8F AB 00 5C 3C 0D 80 33 25 AD DE B0 00 0B 61 40 01 8D 70 B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 6C 00 08 AC 2C B0 6C AF AB 00 4C 8F AE 00 4C 3C 0D B7 00 AD CD 00 00 8F B8 00 4C 24 0F 00 01 AF 0F 00 04 AF A0 00 60 8F B9 00 60 24 01 00 05 17 21 00 CD 00 00 00 00 8C 88 00 34 AF A8 00 64 8F A9 00 64 11 20 00 C8 00 00 00 00 3C 0A 80 34 8D 4A B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 4B 00 08 AC 2B B0 6C AF AA 00 48 8F AD 00 48 3C 0C F8 00 AD AC 00 00 8F AF 00 48 24 0E 00 80 AD EE 00 04 3C 18 80 34 8F 18 B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 27 19 00 08 AC 39 B0 6C AF B8 00 44 8F A9 00 44 3C 08 BC 00 35 08 00 08 AD 28 00 00 8F AB 00 44 3C 0A 12 68 35 4A 12 68 AD 6A 00 04 3C 0C 80 34 8D 8C B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 8D 00 08 AC 2D B0 6C AF AC 00 40 8F AF 00 40 3C 0E B7 00 AD EE 00 00 8F B9 00 40 3C 18 00 01 AF 38 00 04 3C 08 80 34 8D 08 B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 09 00 08 AC 29 B0 6C AF A8 00 3C 8F AB 00 3C 3C 0A B9 00 35 4A 03 1D AD 6A 00 00 8F AD 00 3C 3C 0C F0 50 35 8C 41 C8 AD AC 00 04 3C 0E 80 34 8D CE B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 CF 00 08 AC 2F B0 6C AF AE 00 38 8F B9 00 38 3C 18 FB 00 AF 38 00 00 8F A9 00 38 3C 08 80 80 35 08 80 A0 AD 28 00 04 3C 0A 80 34 8D 4A B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 4B 00 08 AC 2B B0 6C AF AA 00 34 8F AD 00 34 3C 0C B9 00 35 8C 00 02 AD AC 00 00 8F AF 00 34 24 0E 00 03 AD EE 00 04 8F B8 00 64 13 00 00 25 00 00 00 00 3C 19 80 34 8F 39 B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 27 28 00 08 AC 28 B0 6C AF B9 00 30 8F AA 00 30 3C 09 01 02 35 29 00 40 AD 49 00 00 8F AB 00 64 8F AE 00 30 3C 01 1F FF 8D 6C 00 00 34 21 FF FF 01 81 68 24 AD CD 00 04 3C 0F 80 34 8D EF B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 F8 00 08 AC 38 B0 6C AF AF 00 2C 8F A8 00 2C 3C 19 06 00 AD 19 00 00 8F A9 00 64 8F AB 00 2C 8D 2A 00 04 AD 6A 00 04 8F AC 00 64 8D 8D 00 08 AF AD 00 64 8F AE 00 64 15 C0 FF DD 00 00 00 00 3C 0F 80 34 8D EF B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 F8 00 08 AC 38 B0 6C AF AF 00 28 8F A8 00 28 3C 19 B6 00 AD 19 00 00 8F AA 00 28 3C 09 00 01 AD 49 00 04 3C 0B 80 34 8D 6B B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 6C 00 08 AC 2C B0 6C AF AB 00 24 8F AE 00 24 3C 0D FB 00 AD CD 00 00 8F B8 00 24 24 0F FF FF AF 0F 00 04 8C 99 00 34 AF B9 00 64 8F A8 00 64 11 00 00 36 00 00 00 00 3C 09 80 34 AF B8 00 08 8F A8 00 08 3C 0B E7 00 AD 0B 00 00 8F AC 00 08 AD 80 00 04 3C 0A 80 34 8D 4A B0 6C 3C 01 80 34 25 4D 00 08 AC 2D B0 6C AF AA 00 04 8F AE 00 04 3C 0F B6 00 AD CF 00 00 8F B8 00 04 24 19 00 01 AF 19 00 04 10 00 00 01 00 00 00 00 03 E0 00 08 27 BD 00 68



[13] INDIVIDUAL NON-STOP STARS
(credits to Cheezepin)
(does not work when using the Global Behavior Bank, apparently)

*21E200:* 00 06 00 00 11 01 00 01 10 42 04 00 0C 00 00 00 80 2A 41 20 0C 00 00 00 80 2F 24 F4 08 00 00 00 0C 00 00 00 80 2F 25 B0 09 00 00 00

HOW TO USE: Go to a regular star in Quad64, then change its behavior to 0x13004400 and it will not trigger a warp anymore.



[14] SWIMMING SPEED MODIFIER
(credits to scuttlebug_raiser)

.headersize 0x80245000

.org 0x80271b98
lui at, 0xXXXX

.org 0x80271bc4
lui at, 0xYYYY

.org 0x80270cb0
lui at, 0xZZZZ

-----
The values above are placeholders. Insert the following values to adjust the speed.

Speed x1= 3F20, 3FE0, 41F0
Speed x2= 4020, 3FF0, 4240

Speed x1.25= 3F60, 3FE4, 4204
Speed x1.5 = 3FA0, 3FE8, 4218
Speed x1.75= 3FE0, 3FEC, 422C

-----
The differences between 1x and 2x speed are the following:
XXXX = 0x100 (256 in decimal)
YYYY = 0x10 (16 in decimal)
ZZZZ = 0x50 (80 in decimal)
This is to say that if you ADD those values to the values given for 1x speed, you will have 2x speed.
Note that when you change any of the three values, you need to change the other two linearly.
As YYYY reveals, you can adjust the speeds by 16 linear increments until you have gone from 1x to 2x speed.
With that in mind, you'll be able to finetune the swimming speed beyond the given sets of values.
